verbs.description: escalate (third-person singular simple present escalates, present participle escalating, simple past and past participle escalated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To increase (something) in extent or intensity; to intensify or step up.
examples: The shooting escalated the existing hostility.
A small fight escalated into a big fight.

entries.meaning: (transitive) In technical support, to transfer a customer, a problem, etc. to the next higher level of authority
